title: Hide message IDs from chat UI while preserving share/anchor functionality

requirements.text: In MessageBubble.tsx, remove the visible display of the message ID from the rendered chat bubble. The message ID must still exist on the DOM element (e.g., as an id or data attribute) so that URL anchor scrolling and share link functionality continue to work. Do not change any other part of the message bubble layout or logic.

quotes: yes i would like to hide message ids from chat id while maintaining functionality and not making any other changes

acceptanceCriteria: Message IDs are no longer visibly rendered in the chat bubble UI for any message
The DOM element for each message still has an id or data attribute containing the message ID so anchor links work
Clicking the share button on a message still generates a correct share URL with the zero-padded 9-digit message ID
Opening a share URL still scrolls to and highlights the correct message
No other visual or functional changes are present in the chat UI

constraints: Do not change any backend logic
Do not alter share link generation, URL anchoring, or scroll-to-message behavior
Do not modify any other part of the MessageBubble component beyond removing the visible ID display
Do not touch any immutable frontend paths
nonGoals: Removing message IDs from the DOM entirely
Changing the share link format or zero-padding logic
Any other UI or UX changes beyond hiding the visible message ID text
